channel.description: Recent content in Hax on Cryspen

item.title: Formally Verified Post-Quantum Cryptography
item.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) just released the first three standards for Post-Quantum KEMs (ML-KEM) and Signatures (ML-DSA, SLH-DSA).

item.title: Announcing the hax Playground
item.description: We’re proud to announce the hax playground! Inspired by the Rust Playground, the hax playground allows you to play with hax directly in your web browser!

item.title: Cryspen @ FMCP 2024
item.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a number of important cryptographic standards (including upcoming ones for post-quantum cryptography), and runs the cryptographic algorithm and module validation programs that validate and issue certificates to cryptographic libraries.

item.title: Unlocking New Possibilities
item.description: We have been developing the hax toolchain over the last two years, in collaboration with research teams at Inria and the University of Aarhus.

item.title: Cryptographic protocol verification with hax
item.description: This blog post details an example of how to use our hax toolchain for verifying the security of cryptographic protocol implementations written in Rust.

item.title: Conference Talks
item.description: Cryspen attended a number of conference in April and March. Here is a list of all slides and videos. We will update links when more resources become available.

item.title: Verifying Libcrux's ML-KEM
item.description: In a recent blog post, we described Cryspen’s new Rust implementation of ML-KEM in Rust, and talked about how our high-assurance development methodology helped us find a new timing bug in various other Kyber implementations.

item.title: Specifying Oblivious Pseudonymization
item.description: In this blog post we announce an executable specification in the hacspec specification language for the ScrambleDB pseudonymization system, developed by Cryspen as part of the BMBF ATLAS project.

item.title: Prairie and Atlas
item.description: With the widespread adoption and deployment of machine learning across enterprises, ever-increasing amounts of data are being collected, stored, communicated, combined, and computed over by sophisticated algorithms.

item.title: Cryspen @ RWC 2023
item.description: At Real World Crypto 2023 in Tokyo, we gave a talk on the hacspec language, the hax tool, and the libcrux crypto library.

item.title: High Assurance Software Toolchain
item.description: Cryspen collaborates with the Prosecco team at Inria to develop a usable, robust, development environment and verification toolchain for security critical software.
